oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-06-11 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 11, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer), guest performer Sonny James, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, Hank Garland, Archie Campbell, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1079th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Jordanaires; Sonny James; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- Your Old Used To Be (Faron Young) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces the Jordanaires -- On The Battlefield (Jordanaires) -- Faron Young introduces Sonny James -- Jenny Lou (Sonny James, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Tommy Jackson and Jimmie Selph -- Soldier's Joy (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- How Long Has It Been (Faron Young, Jordanaires) -- Grant Turner introduces Hank Garland -- Mack The Knife (Hank Garland)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jackson, Tommy; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jordanaires (Musical group); Selph, Jimmy; Campbell, Archie; Young, Faron; James, Sonny
